sentences: Oled liiga mustad prillid ette pannud!
Vaatas, nägi noori läbi mustade prillide.
Kust oled sa võtnud need mustad prillid, mille läbi näed elu juba aastaid?
context: The word 'mustad' in Estonian is the plural form of 'must', meaning black or dark. In this context, it refers to 'mustad prillid' (dark/black glasses) metaphorically representing a pessimistic way of viewing life - seeing things through dark or negative lenses. The expression 'läbi mustade prillide nägema' means to view something pessimistically.
